body:
i tried it, but did not found a way to implement it. My code looks like below, while it is illegal grammar.  Do you have any idea @benoitsteiner , thanks.

#define REGISTER_NUMBER_SYCL(OP, N, F)          
  #define REGISTER_SYCL_KERNEL(type) REGISTER(OP, SYCL, N, F, type)   \
  TF_CALL_SYCL_NUMBER_TYPES(REGISTER_SYCL_KERNEL);                    \
  #undef REGISTER_SYCL_KERNEL

btw, "\\" does not appear at the end of the macro lines.
body_html:
i tried it, but did not found a way to implement it. My code looks like below, while it is illegal grammar. Do you have any idea @benoitsteiner , thanks.

#define REGISTER_NUMBER_SYCL(OP, N, F)
#define REGISTER_SYCL_KERNEL(type) REGISTER(OP, SYCL, N, F, type)
TF_CALL_SYCL_NUMBER_TYPES(REGISTER_SYCL_KERNEL);
#undef REGISTER_SYCL_KERNEL

btw, "\" does not appear at the end of the macro lines.
body_text:
i tried it, but did not found a way to implement it. My code looks like below, while it is illegal grammar.  Do you have any idea @benoitsteiner , thanks.
#define REGISTER_NUMBER_SYCL(OP, N, F)
#define REGISTER_SYCL_KERNEL(type) REGISTER(OP, SYCL, N, F, type)   
TF_CALL_SYCL_NUMBER_TYPES(REGISTER_SYCL_KERNEL);                    
#undef REGISTER_SYCL_KERNEL
btw, "\" does not appear at the end of the macro lines.
